notes: A flagship mission implemented by MoHUA/ addressing urban housing shortage. The beneficiaries include Economically Weaker Section (EWS) / Low Income Group (LIG) and Middle Income Group (MIG) categories/ including slum dwellers/ by ensuring a pucca house to all eligible urban households by 2022.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Bhartiya Janaushadhi Pariyojana
notes: Pradhan Mantri Bhartiya Janaushadhi Pariyojana was launched by the Department of Pharmaceuticals/ in November 2008. Under the scheme/ dedicated outlets known as Janaushadhi Kendras are opened to make quality generic medicines available to all at affordable prices.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Dakshta Aur Kushalta Sampann Hitgrahi (PM-DAKSH)
notes: The scheme "PM-DAKSH"/ launched by the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment (MoSJ&E)/ aims to empower socially/ educationally/ and economically marginalized groups like SCs/ OBCs/ EWS/ DNTs/ Safai Mitras/ and Waste Pickers by enhancing their skills through high-quality training.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojna (PMFBY)
notes: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana was launched in  2016 with the aim to support farmers by providing an affordable comprehensive risk cover for crops.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Formalisation Of Micro Food Processing Enterprises
notes: Launched on 29th June 2020/ PMFMPE is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme by the MoFPI/ designed to address the challenges faced by the micro enterprises and to tap the potential of groups and cooperatives in supporting the upgradation and formalization of these enterprises.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Urja Suraksha Evam Utthan Mahabhiyan Scheme For Farmers.
notes: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Urja Surakshaevam Utthaan Mahabhiyan Yojana (PM-KUSUM Scheme) was launched in March 2019 by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE)/ to subsidize farmers to install solar irrigation pumps for cultivation. Each farmer will receive a 60% subsidy.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana: Per Drop More Crop
notes: The scheme “Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana: Per Drop More Crop” was launched by the Dept. of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare/ Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare/ Govt. of India on 1st July 2015. The scheme mainly focuses on water use efficiency at farm level through Micro Irrigation.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana
notes: The scheme is to provide maternity benefits to women belonging to socially and economically disadvantaged sections of society. For first child the maternity benefit of ₹5/000 is provided in two instalments under PMMVY and second child/ it is ₹6/000 is to be provided subject to second child is girl.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Kisan Samridhi Sah-yojana (PM-MKSSY): COMPONENT 1A: Formalization of Fisheries Sector and  Capital Financing
notes: The scheme aims to formalise fisheries microenterprises and facilitate their access to institutional working capital finance through small grants and credit intermediaries. It benefits fisheries sector stakeholders registered on NFDP with verifiable credit needs and valid bank accounts.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Kisan Samridhi Sah-yojana (PM-MKSSY): COMPONENT 1B: One-Time Incentive for the Adoption of Aquaculture Insurance
notes: The Component 1B of PM-MKSSY provides a one-time incentive to eligible applicants who have availed institutional credit for fisheries-related activities. The objective is to encourage formal credit adoption and support the repayment capacity of fisheries microenterprises.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana
notes: Introduced by the Department of Fisheries/ Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) is a scheme to bring about ecologically healthy/ economically viable/ and socially inclusive development of the fisheries sector of India.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana
notes: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (PMMY) is  a flagship scheme of Government of India. It facilitates micro credit/Loan upto Rs. 20 lakhs to income generating micro enterprises engaged in the non farm sector in manufacturing/ processing/ trading or service sector including activities allied to agriculture

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar
notes: The Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar (PMRBP) is organized to celebrate the energy/ determination/ ability/ zeal/ and enthusiasm of our children.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana
notes: An Accident Insurance Scheme offering accidental death and disability cover for death or disability on account of an accident.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Uchchatar Shiksha Protsahan (PM-USP) Central Sector Scheme of Scholarship for College and University students
notes: A scholarship scheme by the Dept. of Higher Education to provide financial assistance to meritorious students from poor families to meet a part of their day-to-day expenses while pursuing higher studies. The scholarships are awarded on the basis of results of Higher Secondary / Class 12th Board Exam

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Uchchatar Shiksha Protsahan Yojana - Special Scholarship Scheme for Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh
notes: This initiative provides academic fees and maintenance allowances to support students from Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh pursuing higher education outside the Union Territories

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Uchchatar Shiksha Protsahan Yojana: Central Sector Interest Subsidy Scheme
notes: The scheme provides full interest subsidy during the moratorium period on loan availed under Model Education Loan Scheme of Indian Banks’ Association (IBA) to students belonging to economically weaker sections whose annual parental income is up to ₹4.5 Lakhs from all sources.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana
notes: A scheme by Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas for Providing free LPG connections to women belonging to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) households.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana 2.0
notes: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas (MOPNG)/ introduced the ‘"Pradhan Mantri Ujjawala Yojana 2.0" in India. The Pradhan Mantri Ujjawala Yojana (PMUY) is a scheme launched by the Government of India in 2016 to provide free LPG (liquefied petroleum gas) connections to women from below-poverty-line.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Vidyalaxmi (PM-Vidyalaxmi) Scheme
notes: The "Pradhan Mantri Vidyalaxmi (Pm-vidyalaxmi) Scheme" aims to provide financial support for higher education through education loans. Under this scheme/ financial assistance of up to ₹10/00/000/- is provided to meritorious students seeking admission to domestic institutions.

scheme_name: Pragati Scholarship Scheme For Girl Students (Technical Degree)
notes: A scholarship scheme by MoE for Girl Students admitted in 1st or 2nd Year of the technical degree course in an AICTE approved institution. The benefits are provided for max. 4 years for first-year admitted students and max. 3 years for second-year admitted students through lateral entry.

scheme_name: Pragati Scholarship Scheme For Girl Students (Technical Diploma)
notes: A scholarship scheme by AICTE for Girl Students admitted in 1st or 2nd Year of the technical diploma course in an AICTE approved institution. The benefits are provided for a period of max. of 3 years for first-year students and a max. of 2 years for second-year admitted students (later entry).

scheme_name: Pratyaksh Hanstantrit Labh / Direct Benefits Transfer For LPG
notes: PAHAL (DBTL) has been introduced to curb the diversion of subsidized LPG. Under the scheme/ Consumers will pay the market price for the domestic cylinder and the subsidy will be transferred directly to their bank account

scheme_name: Pravasi Bharatiya Bima Yojana
notes: A mandatory insurance scheme by Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) for safeguarding the interests of Indian emigrant workers falling under Emigration Check Required (ECR) category going for overseas employment to ECR countries.

scheme_name: Pre Matric Scholarship For Minorities
notes: A scholarship scheme by Ministry of Minority Affairs for students from minority communities studying in Class 1st to Class 10th in India in a government or private school/ including such residential Government institutes and eligible private institutes selected and notified in a transparent manner.

scheme_name: Pre Matric Scholarship For Scheduled Tribe Students
notes: A scholarship scheme by Ministry of Tribal Affairs for regular/ full time students from Scheduled Tribe studying in Class 9th and 10th/ in a Government School or in a School recognized by Govt. or a Central/State Board of Secondary Education.

scheme_name: Pre Matric Scholarship For Students With Disabilities
notes: A scholarship scheme by DoEPwDs for Students with Disabilities (SwDs) studying in class 9th and class 10th in a government school or a school recognized by the government or CBSE or State Board. This includes persons with visual/ hearing/ speech/ loco-motor/ mental retardation & other disabilities.

scheme_name: Pre- Matric Scholarships Scheme for Scheduled Castes & Others
notes: The Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme for Scheduled Castes & others is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme implemented by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment/ Government of India.

scheme_name: Pre-Matric Scholarship
notes: The scholarship is designed to provide OBC students with the necessary financial resources studying at pre-matriculation stage to enable them to complete their education.

scheme_name: Pre-Matric Scholarships to the Children of Those Engaged in Occupations Involving Cleaning and Prone to Health Hazards
notes: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to children whose parents/guardians belong to one of the following categories/ to pursue Pre-Matric education: Tanners/ Flayers/ Waste Pickers and Persons who are either presently engaged in Manual Scavenging.

scheme_name: Prime Minister Early Career Research Grant
notes: This programme is initiated by the Anusandhan National Research Foundation (ANRF) to assist researchers to initiate their research career in a new institution with a flexible budget and progressive initiatives for ease of doing research.

scheme_name: Prime Minister's Employment Generation Programme
notes: Launched in August 2008/ Prime Minister's Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP) is a credit-linked subsidy scheme/ administered by the Ministry Of MSME (MSME). PMEGP aims to generate employment opportunities through the establishment of micro-enterprises in

scheme_name: Prime Minister's Scholarship Scheme
notes: Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme (PMSS) was introduced in the academic year 2006-07 by the Department of Ex-servicemen Welfare/ to encourage higher technical and professional education for the dependent wards of Ex-Servicemen / Ex-Coast Guard personnel and their widows.

scheme_name: Prime Minister's Scholarship Scheme for Railway Protection Force
notes: Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme (PMSS) for RPF was announced by Hon’ble Prime Minister of India in his address to the nation from the historical Red Ford on 15th August 2005 to encourage higher technical and professional education for the dependent wards of Ex/Serving RPF/RPSF personnel& widows.

scheme_name: Prime Minister's Scholarship Scheme for the Wards/Widows of Central Police Force Personnel
notes: The scheme “Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme for the Wards/Widows of Central Police Force Personnel” was introduced by the Ministry of Home Affairs/ Govt. of India in the Academic year 2006-07 to encourage higher technical and professional education for the wards of widows and ex-CPFs personnel.

scheme_name: Prime Minister’s Fellowship for Doctoral Research
notes: Prime Minister’s Fellowship for Doctoral Research scheme is a prestigious initiative of Science and Engineering Research Board (SERB)/ Department of Science & Technology/ Government of India towards the advancement of university research engagements in line with industry requirement.

scheme_name: Prime Minister’s Internship Scheme
notes: The scheme aims to provide internship opportunities to one crore youth in top 500 companies in five years. Through this Scheme/ youth will gain exposure for 12 months to real-life business environment/ across varied professions and employment opportunities.

scheme_name: Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme for the Wards of Central Armed Police Forces & Assam Rifles
notes: The scheme was introduced by the Ministry of Home Affairs/ Government of India from the academic year 2006-07 to encourage higher technical & professional education for the dependent wards & widows of Central Armed Police Forces & Assam Rifles (CAPFs & AR) Personnel.

scheme_name: Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme for the Wards of States/UTs Police Personnel
notes: The scheme was introduced by the Ministry of Home Affairs/ Government of India from the academic session 2019-20 to encourage higher technical & professional education for the dependent wards of States/UTs Police Personnel who are martyred during Terror/Naxal attacks.

scheme_name: Production Linked Incentive Scheme (PLI) For Promoting Telecom & Networking Products Manufacturing In India
notes: Production Linked Incentive (PLI) Scheme aims to boost domestic manufacturing/ investments and export in the telecom and networking products The PLI Scheme will be implemented within the overall financial limits of ₹ 12/195 Crores only (Rupees Twelve Thousand One Hundred and Ninety-Five Crore only)

scheme_name: Production Linked Incentive Scheme For Automobile And Auto Component Industry
notes: The government of India has launched the scheme “Production Linked Incentive (PLI) Scheme for Automobile and Auto Components Industry” in India to enhance India’s Manufacturing Capabilities for Advanced Automotive Products.

scheme_name: Programme For Internship For LL.B./ LL.M./ Environmental Studies/ Research Students
notes: The National Green Tribunal provides opportunities to college students by holding Summer Internship Programs (March/ April/ May and July ordinarily) and Winter Internship Programs (November/ December and January ordinarily) Internship Programs for LL.B./ LL.M./ Env. Studies/ Research Students.

scheme_name: Quality Improvement Programme (QIP)
notes: The primary objective of this scheme is to enhance the expertise and capabilities of faculty members in degree and diploma-level institutions across the country. The aim is to enable teachers to acquire Master's and Doctoral degrees and instil in them a culture of research.

scheme_name: RKVY Soil Health and Fertility - Soil Health Card
notes: Soil Health Card is designed to give each farmer soil nutrient status of his/her holding and advice him/her on the dosage of fertilizers and also the needed soil amendments/ that s/he should apply to maintain soil health in the long run.

scheme_name: RKVY Soil Health and Fertility Village level Soil Testing Lab
notes: In order to promote soil test analysis in a campaign mode and to create awareness among farmers about soil health for judicious use of chemical fertilisers/ organic manure/ the component of “Setting of Village-level Soil Testing Laboratories” is being implemented under the scheme.

scheme_name: RMEWF-Financial Assistance For Education Of Children & Widows Of Ex-Servicemen
notes: A scheme to provide financial assistance to Ex-Servicemen and their widows for helping them in educating their child (for maximum two children) up to graduation and also for widows to pursue Post Graduation degree.

scheme_name: RMEWF-Financial Assistance For Ex-Servicemen In Penury
notes: A scheme to provide financial assistance to non-pensioner Ex-Servicemen up to rank of Havildar /equivalent and their widows who are living in extreme poverty.

scheme_name: RMEWF-Financial Assistance For Medical Treatment Of Ex-Servicemen
notes: A scheme to provide financial assistance to a non-pensioner Ex-Servicemen/widows of ranks up to Havildar/equivalent to meet routine medical expenses.

scheme_name: RMEWF-Financial Assistance For Vocational Training Of Widows Of Ex-Servicemen
notes: A scheme to provide financial assistance to a widow of Ex-Servicemen to settle in life through vocational training.

scheme_name: RMEWF-Financial Assistance To 100% Disabled Child Of Ex-Servicemen
notes: A scheme to provide financial assistance to Ex-Servicemen or their widows for their 100% disabled child.

scheme_name: Rainfed Area Development
notes: Rainfed Area Development (RAD) scheme was launched in 2014-15 to mainstream development of rainfed areas in a sustainable manner. It adopts an area-based approach/ focuses on Integrated Farming System (IFS) for enhancing productivity and minimizing risks associated with climatic variability.

scheme_name: Rajbhasha Gaurav Puraskar Scheme for writing original book in Hindi
notes: The scheme “Rajbhasha Gaurav Puraskar Scheme for writing original book in Hindi” was launched by the Department of Official Language/ Ministry of Home Affairs/ Government of India with an objective to encourage writing books originally in Hindi and to promote Official Language.

scheme_name: Rajiv Gandhi National Fellowship For Scheduled Caste Candidates
notes: The Rajiv Gandhi National Fellowship (RGNF) Scheme for Scheduled Caste is formulated and funded by the Ministry of Social Justice &Empowerment. The scheme is open to candidates who belong to Scheduled Caste and are pursuing higher studies such as regular and full-time M.Phil.and Ph.D.degrees.

scheme_name: Ramalingaswami Re-Entry Fellowship
notes: The Department of Biotechnology has instituted a scheme known as the “Ramalingaswami Re-Entry Fellowship”. The scheme is aimed at Indian Nationals who are working overseas in various fields of biotechnology and life sciences and are interested in taking up scientific research positions in India.

scheme_name: Raman-Charpak Fellowship
notes: The “Raman-Charpak Fellowship Programme” is in honour of two Nobel Laureates in Physics/ Prof C.V. Raman/ Indian Nobel Laureate (1930) & Prof Georges Charpak/ French Nobel Laureate (1992). The Fellowship was launched during the State visit of the President of France to India in February/ 2013.

scheme_name: Ramanujan Fellowship
notes: Ramanujan Fellowship was started by the Science and Engineering Research Board/ Govt. of India for brilliant Indian scientists and engineers from outside India to take up scientific research positions in India/ those Indian scientists/engineers who want to return to India from abroad.

scheme_name: Rashtriya Gram Swaraj Abhiyan
notes: Rashtriya Gram Swaraj Abhiyan (RGSA) was launched on 24th April 2018 'National Panchayat Day' by the Hon'ble Prime Minister/ an umbrella scheme of the Ministry of Panchayati Raj. It is a unique scheme proposed to develop and strengthen the Panchayati Raj System across India in rural areas.

scheme_name: Rashtriya Gram Swaraj Abhiyan - Internship Program
notes: The 'Internship Program' as part of the Framework for Implementation of Centrally Sponsored Scheme of Revamped Rashtriya Gram Swaraj Abhiyan (RGSA) (2022-23 to 2025-26) of the Ministry of Panchayati Raj (MoPR)/ Government of India (Gol)/ seeks to engage 'Students'.

scheme_name: Rashtriya Parivar Sahayata Yojana
notes: This scheme is being executed for the family members who are unable to make their livelihood after the death of the primary breadwinner of the family.

scheme_name: Rashtriya Vigyan Puraskar
notes: The objective of the Rashtriya Vigyan Puraskar (RVP) is to recognise the notable and inspiring contribution made by the scientists/ technologists and innovators individually or in teams in various fields of science/ technology and technology- led innovation.

scheme_name: Rastriya Arogya Nidhi - Health Minister’s Cancer Patient Fund
notes: A scheme to provide financial assistance to poor patients living below poverty line and suffering from cancer/ for their treatment at 27 Regional cancer centers (RCCs).

scheme_name: Raw Material Assistance Scheme
notes: Raw Material Assistance Scheme aims to help MSMEs by way of financing the purchase of Raw Material (Both indigenous & imported). This gives an opportunity to MSMEs to focus better on manufacturing quality products.

scheme_name: Reimbursement of membership Fee in Government promoted E-Commerce Portals
notes: Reimbursement of Membership fee of Government promoted e-commerce portals Scheme is a sub scheme under National Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe Hub (NSSH) scheme.

scheme_name: Relief and Rehabilitation Assistance to Sri Lankan Refugees in the Refugee Camps
notes: The scheme provides relief materials/ which among other things include Feeding Charges/ Subsidized Rice/ Clothing Materials/ Utensils/ Transportation Charges (on arrival)/ Porterage and Transport (on repatriation)/ Cash Doles/ Infrastructure Facilities (at camps)/ Electricity/ Drinking Water/ etc.

scheme_name: Research Associates (RA)
notes: The Research Associates (RAs) of the Department of Biotechnology (DBT) in India are individuals who engage in research work under the DBT-Research Associateship Program in Biotechnology and its was started in 1999.

scheme_name: Research Fellowship In Sciences For Meritorious Students
notes: The Research Fellowship in Sciences for meritorious students (RFSMS) scheme of the UGC is open to candidates who have registered for Ph.D. in Science in Universities with Potential for Excellence/Centres with Potential for Excellence/Centres of Advance Studies and Department of Special Assistance.

scheme_name: Research Grant For In-Service Faculty Members
notes: The scheme "Research Grant for In-Service Faculty Members" was introduced by the University Grants Commission (UGC)/ Department of Higher Education (DoHE). The objective of this research grant is to provide opportunities to regularly appointed faculty members of Universities/ Institutes/ Colleges.

scheme_name: Right To Information Fellowship
notes: Under this scheme/ DOPT proposes to offer four short-term fellowships to researchers from the field of media / Civil Society professionals / RTI Trainers to conduct field-based research on themes relating to RTI. It is hoped that the research output will enhance their understanding of the RTI Act.

scheme_name: SAHAKAR MITRA: NCDC’s Scheme on Internship Programme
notes: The programme aims at providing an opportunity to professional graduates to get experience in areas of functioning of NCDC and related aspects of cooperatives.

scheme_name: SEBI ITD Internship Program
notes: The SEBI ITD Internship Program provides hands-on training to the students of the institutes based in and around Mumbai. The program accepts up to 15 interns. The Interns accepted under this program would be given an opportunity to work on different Information Technology (IT) projects.

scheme_name: SERB - POWER Fellowship
notes: The SERB - POWER Fellowship is designed to identify and reward excellent women researchers in Indian academic institutions and R&D laboratories/ holding Ph.D. degrees in any branch of science and engineering.

scheme_name: SERB - POWER Research Grants
notes: The aim of the ‘SERB - POWER Research Grants’ is to encourage emerging and eminent women researchers for individual-centric and competitive mode of research funding to undertake R&D activities in frontier areas of science and engineering.

scheme_name: SERB International Research Experience
notes: The Science and Engineering Research Board (SERB)/ a statutory body under the Department of Science and Technology/ Government of India has launched "SERB International Research Experience (SIRE)".

scheme_name: SERB Research Scientist Scheme
notes: SERB Board has launched a new ‘SERB Research Scientist (SRS) Scheme’ for the awardees of INSPIRE Faculty and Ramanujan Fellowships/ who fail to secure regular positions after completion of the regular tenure of five years in the respective schemes.

scheme_name: SERB Science and Technology Award for Research
notes: “SERB Science and Technology Award for Research (SERB-STAR)” is a prestigious award instituted by Science and Engineering Research Board (SERB) to recognize and reward outstanding performance of Principal Investigators (PIs) of SERB Projects.

scheme_name: SERB-Technology Translation Award
notes: The “SERB-Technology Translation Award (SERB-TETRA)” is a new scheme launched by the Science and Engineering Research Board/ Government of India for catalyzing technology translation in academic settings.

scheme_name: SITARE-Appreciation Grant
notes: SITARE-Appreciation Grant: Residential workshops called as Biotech Innovation Ignition School (BIIS) for undergraduate students are organized to provide hands-on technical training and mentorship for problem identification in 3-4 weeks duration.

scheme_name: SITARE-Gandhian Young Technological Innovation Award Grant
notes: Under SITARE-GYTI scheme component/ 15 innovative student projects will receive funding support of upto INR 15 lakhs each. The scheme encourages postgraduate & doctoral students to undertake projects with commercial potential leading to the creation of biotech startups.

scheme_name: SMILE - Comprehensive Rehabilitation For Welfare Of Transgender Persons
notes: A scheme to provide Financial Assistance in the form of scholarships is provided to Transgender students studying in secondary school (IX & X)  & senior secondary school (XI & XII) to reduce the incidence of dropout and support their educational aspirations.

scheme_name: SMILE - Comprehensive Rehabilitation For Welfare Of Transgender Persons – Skill Development And Training
notes: The scheme aims to provide employment opportunities to the person belonging to transgender person community by providing them market-oriented skills.

scheme_name: SVAMITVA Yojana (Survey of Villages and Mapping with Improvised Technology in Village Areas)
notes: SVAMITVA/ a Central Sector scheme of Ministry of Panchayati Raj to provide ‘Record of Rights’ to village household owners with issuance of legal ownership cards (Property cards/Title deeds) to the property owners by mapping of land parcels using drone technology.

scheme_name: Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana
notes: Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana aims to translate the comprehensive vision of Mahatma Gandhi about an ideal Indian village into reality/ keeping in view the present context. Each Member of Parliament adopts a Gram Panchayat and guides its holistic progress giving importance to social development.

scheme_name: Samarth-Respite Care Scheme
notes: Samarth (Respite Care) scheme/ launched by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities/ aims at setting up Samarth Centres for providing respite and residential care for the specified categories of Persons with Disability (PwD).

scheme_name: Savitribai Jyotirao Phule Fellowship For Single Girl Child
notes: Savitribai Jyotirao Phule Fellowship for Single Girl Child (SJSGC) is a Fellowship Scheme by the University Grants Commission (UGC)/ Department of Higher Education/ for pursuing research work leading to the award of a Ph.D. degree. The target group of this scheme is the ‘single girl child'.

scheme_name: Scheme For Adolescent Girls
notes: A support scheme by Ministry of Women & Child Development enabling self-development and empowerment of out-of-school adolescent girls/ and improving their nutritional/ health & hygiene  status. All out-of-school adolescent girls in the 11 to 14 years age group are eligible for this scheme.

scheme_name: Scheme For Award Of Financial Assistance For Education To The Wards Of Beedi/Cine/IOMC/LSDM Workers – Pre & Post-Matric
notes: A scholarship scheme by the Directorate of Social Welfare/ Ministry of Labour and Employment wherein financial assistance for education is provided to the Wards of Beedi/IOMC/LSDM Workers/ varying from ₹1/000/- to ₹25/000/- per student per annum. The benefits are transferred through the DBT system.

scheme_name: Scheme For Award Of Senior/Junior Fellowships To Outstanding Persons In The Fields Of Culture
notes: The scheme “Scheme for Award of Senior/Junior Fellowships to Outstanding Persons in the Fields of Culture” was launched by the Ministry of Culture/ Government of India.

scheme_name: Scheme For Campus Accommodation & Facilities Enhancing Social Experience
notes: Scheme for Campus Accommodation & Facilities Enhancing Social Experience (CAFES) was introduced by AICTE to provide financial assistance for construction of hostel to create a congenial study atmosphere free from the shackles of domestic shores so as to encourage students to purse their education.

scheme_name: Scheme For Financial Assistance For Veteran Artists
notes: A pension scheme by MoC improves the financial and socio-economic status of the old artists and scholars who have contributed significantly in their specialized fields. Still/ due to old age/ they have to lead a miserable life or are in penury condition.

scheme_name: Scheme For Grant Of Rewards To The Children Of Salt Labourers
notes: The scheme “Scheme for Grant of Rewards to the Children of Salt Labourers” was launched by Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT)/ Ministry of Commerce and Industry in the year 1985.

scheme_name: Scheme Of Assistance To Disabled Persons For Purchase/Fitting Of Aids/Appliances
notes: The main objective of the Scheme is to assist needy disabled persons in procuring durable/ sophisticated/ scientifically manufactured/ modern/ standard aids and appliances that can promote their physical/ social and psychological rehabilitation by reducing the effect of disabilities.

scheme_name: Scheme Of Financial Assistance For The Preservation And Development Of Cultural Heritage Of The Himalayas
notes: The scheme “Scheme of Financial Assistance for the Preservation and Development of Cultural Heritage of the Himalayas” was launched by the Ministry of Culture/ Government of India.

scheme_name: Scheme for Grant of Financial Assistance for Administering Road Safety Advocacy
notes: The objective of the Scheme is to stimulate and encourage opportunities for various agencies through participation/ in order to create awareness on road safety.

scheme_name: Scheme for Plantation Development (New planting & Replanting) under Medium Term Framework Plan (MTFP)
notes: The Scheme is intended to increase the production of natural rubber in India by accelerating new planting and replanting of rubber on scientific lines. Accelerated new planting/replanting would be achieved by giving proper technical guidance and financial assistance to growers.

scheme_name: Scheme for Supportive Money to the Parents of Transgender Children
notes: The "Scheme for Supportive Money to the Parents of Transgender Children" aims to provide financial assistance of ₹1/000/- to the parents of transgender children. Transgender persons face stigma and discrimination in almost every sphere of their life including within the group/ health facilities.

scheme_name: Scheme of Assistance for the Prevention of Alcoholism & Substance (Drugs) Abuse and for Social Defence Services
notes: The scheme aims to meet needs falling within the mandate of the Ministry which cannot be met under its regular schemes and support such initiatives of an innovative/pilot nature in the area of welfare and empowerment of the Ministry’s target groups/ as cannot be supported under its regular schemes.

scheme_name: Scheme of Fund for Regeneration of Traditional Industries
notes: To make the traditional industries more productive and competitive and facilitating their sustainable development/ the Govt. of India announced in 2005-06/ setting up of a fund for the regeneration of traditional industries. Pursuant to this announcement/ a Central Sector Scheme titled the “SFURTI".

scheme_name: Scheme of Grant-in-Aid for Professional Associations/ Organisations of Social Scientists including Universities/ Colleges
notes: The Indian Council of Social Science Research (ICSSR)/ under the Ministry of Education/ Government of India/ provides Grants-in-Aid to professional associations/ organisations of social scientists/ universities/ colleges/ and research institutes

scheme_name: Scheme of Grant-in-Aid to Voluntary Organisations Working for the Welfare of Scheduled Tribes
notes: The Central Sector Scheme “Scheme of Grant-in-Aid to Voluntary Organisations Working for the Welfare of Scheduled Tribes” was launched by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs/ Government of India.

scheme_name: Scheme of Grant-in-Aid to Voluntary and other Organizations Working for Scheduled Castes
notes: The "Scheme aims to enhance the reach of development interventions of the Government and fill the gaps in service-deficient Scheduled Caste-dominant areas in sectors such as education/ health/ vocational training/ etc./ through the efforts of voluntary organizations and other organizations.

scheme_name: Scheme of Grants-in-Aid for supporting professional associations/ organisations of social scientists/ and companies
notes: The Indian Council of Social Science Research (ICSSR)/ under the Ministry of Education/ Government of India/ provides Grants-in-Aid for supporting professional associations/ organisations of social scientists/ companies and trusts  for their development.

scheme_name: Scheme of Internship for Post-Graduate/Research Students
notes: MoSPI is implementing the scheme of Internship for Post-graduate/Research Students of Statistics/ Mathematical Statistics/ Operations Research/ Economics/ Demography or any of the applied field of Statistics of recognized Universities//Institutions.

scheme_name: Scheme of Internship of Students to DRDO Labs/Estts for Project Training
notes: The scheme aims to provide an opportunity and exposure to future graduates and postgraduates in Engineering and General Sciences to the research and development activities carried out by DRDO in state-of-the-art technology in fields relevant to the defense sector.

scheme_name: Scheme of Publication Grant/Subsidy for Publication of Doctoral Thesis/Research Report/ Papers Presented in Seminars/Conferences/ etc.
notes: The Indian Council of Social Science Research (ICSSR)/ under the Ministry of Education/ Government of India/ provides financial assistance for the publication of high-quality doctoral theses/ research project/fellowship reports/ and seminar/conference papers in the field of social sciences.

scheme_name: Scholarship Scheme for Girl Children of Jute Mills / MSMEs Workers
notes: National Jute Board Act/ 2008 provides to “secure better working conditions and provisions and improve amenities and incentives for workers engaged in the jute industry.”

scheme_name: Security Related Expenditure (Relief and Rehabilitation)
notes: The scheme aims to support the relief and rehabilitation of the Kashmiri migrants who have been uprooted from the Valley during the militancy period besides other relief & rehabilitation measures. "SRE (R&R) Scheme" is a component of the Umbrella scheme/ 'Modernization of Police Forces (MPF)".

scheme_name: Self Employment Scheme For Rehabilitation Of Manual Scavengers
notes: The Self Employment Scheme for Rehabilitation of Manual Scavengers (SRMS) was introduced in January 2017 by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment/ to assist the identified manual scavengers and their dependants in rehabilitation in alternative occupations.

scheme_name: Senior Citizens Saving Scheme
notes: Introduced in 2004 by the Govt. of India/ SCSS offers a steady stream of income for individuals over 60 years old. As it is a government-backed scheme/ there is minimal risk associated with SCSS. Individuals can apply for this scheme in post offices and public and private banks.

scheme_name: Seva Bhoj Yojna
notes: The scheme “Seva Bhoj Yojna” was launched by the Ministry of Culture/ Government of India and it has been made operational with effect from the 1st of August/ 2018. The scheme shall be applicable within the territorial jurisdiction of India and will remain open from the 1st to 15th of every month.

scheme_name: Shahari Waqf Sampatti Vikas Yojana
notes: Under the scheme/ interest free loan to Waqf Boards (WBs)/waqf institutions is granted to various Waqf Boards and Waqf Institutions in the country for construction of economically viable buildings on the Waqf land/ such as commercial complex/ marriage halls/ hospitals/ cold storage etc..

scheme_name: Shilp Guru Award
notes: The “Shilp Guru Award” for master craftspersons was introduced by the Ministry of Textiles to honor legendary master craftspersons of handicrafts whose work and dedication have contributed not only to the preservation but also to the promotion of the rich and diverse craft heritage of the country.

scheme_name: Short Term Fellowship under the Human Resource Development Programme for Health Research
notes: Short Term Fellowship under the Human Resource Development Programme for Health Research aims to provide advanced training in India & abroad to medical and health research personnel in cutting-edge research areas related to medicine & health.

scheme_name: Single Point Registration Scheme
notes: National Small Industries Corporation enlists Micro & Small Enterprises under Single Point Registration scheme for participation in Government Purchases. The units enlisted under this scheme of NSIC are eligible to get the benefits under Public Procurement Policy for Micro & Small Enterprises.

scheme_name: Skill Loan Scheme
notes: A Skill loan scheme by Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship to provide loan upto Rs. 1/50/000 to student who has secured admission in a course run by Industrial Training Institutes (ITIs)/ Polytechnics or in a school recognized by Central or State education Boards or in a college affil

scheme_name: Solar Energy Corporation of India (SECI) Internship
notes: The SECI Internship Policy is designed to provide practical experience to students in the renewable energy sector. The program aims to give interns exposure to SECI's various divisions/ helping them understand the renewable energy sector.

scheme_name: Special Credit Linked Capital Subsidy Scheme (SCLCSS) for Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe
notes: Special Credit Linked Capital Subsidy Scheme (SCLCSS) for Scheduled Caste / Scheduled scheme aims to facilitate capital subsidy to SC/ST MSEs for purchasing of plant & machinery/equipment through institutional finance (bank loan).

scheme_name: Stand-Up India
notes: A scheme by Ministry of Finance for financing SC/ST and  Women Entrepreneurs by facilitating bank loans for setting up a greenfield project  Enterprise in manufacturing/ services/ trading sector and activities allied to agriculture.

scheme_name: Star College Scheme For Strengthening Of Science Education And Training At Undergraduate Level
notes: The Dept. of Biotechnology has launched "Star College Scheme for Strengthening of Science Education and Training at Undergraduate Level" for improving critical thinking and 'hands-on' experimental work at the undergraduate (college) level in sciences.

scheme_name: Startup India Seed Fund Scheme- For Incubators
notes: The scheme “Startup India Seed Fund Scheme (SISFS)” was launched by the DPIIT on 19th April 2021 to provide financial assistance to startups for proof of concept/ prototype development/ product trials/ market-entry/ and commercialization.

scheme_name: Startup India Seed Fund Scheme- For Startups
notes: The scheme “Startup India Seed Fund Scheme (SISFS)” was launched by the DPIIT on 19th April 2021 with an outlay of INR 945 Crore to provide financial assistance to startups for Proof of Concept/ prototype development/ product trials/ market-entry/ and commercialization.

scheme_name: Student Internship Programme
notes: The Student Internship Program/ a unique learning opportunity aims to provide the Interns exposure to the functioning of the CAG of India and the Indian Audit & Accounts Department.

scheme_name: Students Ready
notes: The Student Rural Entrepreneurship Awareness Development Yojana (READY)  was launched by Hon'ble Prime Minister on 25 July 2015.

scheme_name: Sub-mission On Agriculture Mechanization
notes: The Sub-Mission on Agricultural Mechanization was launched in 2014-15 by the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare.

scheme_name: Sub-mission on Breed Development of Livestock and Poultry
notes: The Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying introduced the National Livestock Mission as umbrella scheme. The "Sub-mission on Breed Development of Livestock and Poultry" is the realigned National Livestock Mission/ which is the scheme's sub-mission.

scheme_name: Summer Internship Programme (PRL)
notes: The Physical Research Laboratory (PRL) Summer Internship Programme aims to provide a platform for highly motivated students & teachers to interact with PRL’s scientists/ gaining exposure to the lab’s research areas and facilities. Participants will work on projects in fundamental science/ technology

scheme_name: Summer Internship Scheme Of DGFT
notes: The Summer Internship Scheme by the Directorate General of Foreign Trade is for the interaction of the officers of the Directorate with young scholars and researchers with brilliant academic backgrounds from reputed academic institutions pursuing Studies/Research in Public Policy/Economics/Law etc.

scheme_name: Supporting Community Radio Movement in India
notes: The GOI has a policy for grant of License to eligible organisations for setting up of Community Radio Stations. To support the Sector/ the Scheme provides financial assistance once the Community Radio is made operational by eligible organisation. The Scheme also has components for capacity building.

scheme_name: Surakshit Matritva Aashwasan Yojana
notes: SUMAN Yojana is a maternity benefit initiative by MoH&FW. This program provides affordable and quality healthcare solutions to pregnant women and newborns. The scheme provides zero expense access up to six months after delivery. Upto antenatal check-ups during the 1st trimester are provided.

scheme_name: Swachh Bharat Mission (Grameen) Phase II
notes: A sanitation scheme for Visual cleanliness through Open Defecation Free (ODF) sustainability and effective management of solid and liquid waste in villages.

scheme_name: Swachh Bharat Mission – Grameen PHASE I
notes: The scheme aims to eliminate open defecation and improve rural sanitation by supporting toilet construction and promoting usage among poor and marginalized rural households.

scheme_name: Swachh Bharat Mission – Urban 2.0
notes: A sanitation scheme for the construction of Individual Household Latrines (IHHL) for urban households.

scheme_name: Swami Vivekananda Single Girl Child Fellowship for Research in Social Sciences
notes: A fellowship scheme by the University Grants Commission (UGC) for Single Girl Child for research in Social Sciences with an aim to compensate for direct costs of higher education/ especially for such girls who happen to be the only girl child in their family.

scheme_name: Swarnajayanti Fellowships Scheme
notes: Under this scheme/ a selected number of young scientists/ with proven track record/ are provided special assistance and support to enable them to pursue basic research in frontier areas of science and technology.

scheme_name: Swatantrata Sainik Samman Pension Scheme
notes: Launched on 15th August 1972/ "Swatantrata Sainik Samman Pension Scheme" is a Pension Scheme by the Ministry of Home Affairs. The scheme provides the grant of pension to living freedom fighters and their families; if they are no more alive/ and to the families or martyrs.

scheme_name: TEC Internship Scheme
notes: The ‘TEC Internship Scheme’ intends to engage 25 Interns in order to study/formulate/operationalize/assess various works/projects/policies etc. The internship will provide an opportunity for young scholars to contribute to the TEC work and have insight into the related technical work.

scheme_name: Tagore National Fellowship for Cultural Research
notes: The Scheme has been introduced to invigorate and revitalize the various institutions under the Ministry of Culture and other identified cultural institutions in the country/ by encouraging Fellows/academicians to affiliate themselves with these institutions to work on projects of mutual interest.

scheme_name: Tagore National Scholarship for Cultural Research
notes: The Scheme has been introduced to invigorate and revitalize the various institutions under the Ministry of Culture and other identified cultural institutions in the country/ by encouraging Scholars/academicians to affiliate themselves with these institutions to work on projects of mutual interest.

scheme_name: Tea Development and Promotion Scheme (TDPS): Plantation Development for Small Tea Growers (PDSTG): Mechanization for Individual Small Growers
notes: The objective of this component is to increase the production/ productivity and quality of tea/ overall development of small tea growers to help them move up in the value chain/ sustainability of production by promoting organic tea cultivation& climate resilient tea and to make them self-reliant.

scheme_name: Teachers Associateship for Research Excellence
notes: The scheme “Teachers Associateship for Research Excellence (TARE)” was launched by Science & Engineering Research Board/ Department of Science & Technology/ Government of India which aims to facilitate mobility of faculty members working in State Universities /Colleges/Private Academic institutions.

scheme_name: Technology Development And Utilization Programme For Women
notes: In order to meet the specific needs of women and to enhance the contribution of women towards technology capability building/ the “Technology Development & Utilization Programme for Women (TDUPW)” has been formulated by the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research (DSIR).

scheme_name: Technology Development Fund (TDF) Scheme
notes: Technology Development Fund (TDF) has been established to promote self-reliance in Defence Technology as a part of the 'Make in India' initiative.

scheme_name: Telecom Technology Development Fund
notes: The Telecom Technology Development Fund Scheme (hereinafter referred to as ‘Scheme’) has been notified for domestic companies and institutions involved in technology design/ development/ commercialization of telecommunication products and solutions to enable affordable broadband and mobile services.

scheme_name: Tenzing Norgay National Adventure Award
notes: MYAS confers the Tenzing Norgay National Adventure Award in order to recognize the achievements of persons associated with the field of adventure and to encourage young people to develop the spirit of endurance/ risk-taking/ cooperative teamwork/ and quick/ ready/ and effective reflexes.

scheme_name: Testing Fee Reimbursement Scheme
notes: Testing Fee Reimbursement Scheme for Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe is a sub scheme under National Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe Hub (NSSH) scheme.

scheme_name: The Inland Waterways Authority of India Internship Scheme
notes: The purpose of this scheme is to provide with Selected Candidates” short term exposure to different verticals/ divisions/ units of IWAI as “Interns”. An intern may be required to work at Head Office or Project Office depending upon the requirement of the Authority.

scheme_name: The Lokpal of India Internship Scheme
notes: The Lokpal of India launched the Internship Scheme for the interns to learn about the implementation of the Lokpal & Lokayuktas Act/ the Prevention of Corruption Act/ the Central Vigilance Commission Act/ & they can contribute towards the effective functioning of the Lokpal of India with fresh ideas

scheme_name: The NSFDC Internship Scheme
notes: The NSFDC Internship Scheme 2024 is implemented by the National Scheduled Castes Finance & Development Corporation/ Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment/ Govt. of India. The internship will expose students to various programs & schemes undertaken by NSFDC/ offering them hands-on experience in

scheme_name: Top Class Education For Scheduled Caste Students
notes: A scholarship scheme by Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment for Scheduled Caste students pursuing studies beyond class 12th admitted in a full-time course in one of the notified institutions. The total annual family income from all sources must be less than or equal to Rs. 8.00 lakh.

scheme_name: Top Class Education For Students With Disabilities
notes: A scholarship scheme by DoEPwDs for Students with Disabilities (SwDs) pursuing studies beyond class 12th admitted in a full-time course in one of the 'notified institutions'.

scheme_name: Travel Grant Scheme For College Teachers / College Librarians / Vice Chancellors / Commission Members And UGC Officers
notes: This scheme provides financial assistance to permanent teachers and librarians of colleges and vice-chancellors of state universities/ deemed to be universities and central universities to present research papers at international conferences abroad.

scheme_name: Upgrading the Skills and Training in Traditional Arts/Crafts for Development
notes: The Upgrading the Skills and Training in Traditional Arts/Crafts for Development (USTTAD) scheme is a program launched by the Ministry of Minority Affairs/ Government of India/ in 2015.

scheme_name: VAIshwik BHArtiya Vaigyanik (VAIBHAV) Fellowship
notes: VAIBHAV Fellowship envisages collaboration between scientists of Indian Diaspora with Indian Higher Educational Institutions/Universities/Public Funded Scientific Institutions. Fellow would identify an Indian Institution for collaboration & may spend upto two months in a year for a max. of 3 years.

scheme_name: Vanchit Ikai Samooh Aur Vargon Ko Aarthik Sahayata Yojana
notes: The VISVAS (Vanchit Ikai Samooh aur Vargon ko Aarthik Sahayata) Scheme aims to provide interest subvention to OBC/SC Self Help Groups (SHGs) or individuals. It is being implemented by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment.

scheme_name: Vice Chancellor Internship Scheme
notes: The Vice Chancellor Internship Scheme (VCIS) by the University of Delhi aims to provide students with experiential learning opportunities/ integrating academic knowledge with practical work experience. This initiative aligns with the objectives of "Samagra Shiksha" (holistic education) as outlined..

scheme_name: Vikaas-Day Care Scheme For Person with Disability Children
notes: Vikaas is a Day care scheme/ primarily to expand the range of opportunities available to a person with disability attaining the age of 10 years for enhancing interpersonal and vocational skills as they are on a transition to higher age groups.

scheme_name: Aadabidda Nidhi
notes: Provides financial assistance of ₹1/500 per month to every eligible woman aged 18-59.

scheme_name: Ambedkar Overseas Vidya Nidhi (AOVN)
notes: Financial assistance for students from marginalized communities to pursue higher education in top-ranked foreign universities.

scheme_name: AMRUT / Smart Cities Mission - State Share
notes: State's financial and administrative contribution to the central missions for developing infrastructure in designated cities.

scheme_name: Anganwadi Services (ICDS)
notes: A foundational central-state partnership providing nutrition/ immunization/ health check-ups/ and pre-school education.

scheme_name: Annadata Sukhibhava
notes: Provides enhanced financial assistance of ₹20/000 annually to farmers.

scheme_name: AP State Skill Development Corporation (APSSDC) Schemes
notes: Offers a wide range of industry-aligned skill development and vocational training programs for youth to enhance employability.

scheme_name: Arogya Asara
notes: Provides post-operative financial assistance (up to ₹5/000 per month) to patients to cover sustenance during their recovery period.

scheme_name: BC/ EBC/ Kapu/ Brahmin Welfare Corporation Schemes
notes: These corporations run various schemes including subsidized loans/ financial aid/ and skill development programs for their respective communities.

scheme_name: Chandranna Bima
notes: Provides insurance coverage (up to ₹5 lakh) to families of unorganized workers in case of accidental death or disability.

scheme_name: Chandranna Chedodu
notes: Provides annual financial assistance of ₹10/000 to support small businessmen like tailors/ barbers/ and washermen (Rajakas).

scheme_name: Chandranna Pelli Kanuka
notes: Provides one-time financial assistance for the marriage of girls from poor families belonging to SC/ST/BC/Minority/Differently-abled communities.

scheme_name: Chandranna Vahana Mitra
notes: Annual financial assistance of ₹10/000 to owner-cum-drivers of autos/ taxis/ and maxi-cabs.

scheme_name: Deepam Scheme
notes: Provision of 3 free gas cylinders per year to every eligible household.

scheme_name: Differently Abled Welfare Schemes
notes: Besides pensions/ this includes the distribution of tricycles/ wheelchairs/ hearing aids/ and other assistive devices/ as well as subsidized travel passes.

scheme_name: Diesel Subsidy for Fishermen
notes: Provides subsidized diesel for registered fishing boats to reduce operational costs.

scheme_name: Dokka Seethamma Madhyahana Badi Bhojanam
notes: Provides nutritious and quality mid-day meals to all students in government and aided schools.

scheme_name: Dr. YSR Polambadi (Farm School)
notes: An extension program where progressive farmers teach best practices in agriculture to fellow farmers in their own fields.

scheme_name: Free Bus Travel for Women
notes: Offers free travel for all women on state-run RTC buses across Andhra Pradesh.

scheme_name: Grama/Ward Volunteers
notes: A system where a volunteer is assigned to approximately 50 households for door-to-door delivery of welfare benefits and services.

scheme_name: Incentives for Civil Services Examination
notes: Financial rewards for UPSC aspirants who clear Prelims (₹1 lakh) and Mains (₹50/000) stages.

scheme_name: Input Subsidy for Crop Loss
notes: Direct benefit transfer to farmers as compensation for crop damage due to natural calamities.

scheme_name: Interest-free loans for Street Vendors
notes: Facilitates interest-free bank loans of ₹10/000 to street vendors and traditional artisans (linked with PM SVANidhi).

scheme_name: Intintiki Kulai Neeru
notes: A flagship mission to provide a functional household tap water connection to every home for a safe and adequate water supply.

scheme_name: Jala Yagnam / Irrigation Projects
notes: A long-term state focus on completing pending and starting new irrigation projects to ensure water security for agriculture.

scheme_name: Law Nestham
notes: Provides a monthly stipend of ₹5/000 to junior lawyers during their first three years of practice.

scheme_name: Mana Badi Mana Bhavishyattu
notes: Comprehensive program for upgrading infrastructure in all government schools.

scheme_name: Matsyakara Bharosa
notes: Provides financial aid of ₹10/000 to fishermen families during the annual marine fishing ban period.

scheme_name: MeeBhoomi / Webland
notes: A digital portal providing public access to land records/ enabling citizens to view details of their property online.

scheme_name: MGNREGS - State Component
notes: State-level implementation of the central scheme that guarantees 100 days of wage employment to rural households.

scheme_name: Minority Welfare Schemes
notes: Includes financial support for Dargahs/Masjids/ scholarships/ and assistance for Christian pilgrimages to Jerusalem.

scheme_name: National Health Mission (NHM) - State Component
notes: State-level implementation of various national health programs for maternal health/ child health/ and disease control.

scheme_name: NTR Bharosa Pension
notes: Provides a monthly social security pension to the elderly/ widows/ disabled persons/ and other vulnerable groups.

scheme_name: NTR Housing Scheme
notes: Aims to provide affordable/ permanent housing for the economically weaker sections in urban and rural areas.

scheme_name: NTR Vaidya Seva
notes: The state's flagship health insurance scheme providing free/ cashless healthcare services for serious illnesses to BPL families/ with an enhanced coverage limit.

scheme_name: Pashu Kranthi Pathakam (Animal Husbandry)
notes: Subsidized distribution of high-yield cattle/ sheep/ and goats to enhance the livelihood of rural families.

scheme_name: Post Matric Scholarship RTF & MTF
notes: Comprehensive scheme for full tuition fee reimbursement (RTF) and maintenance/hostel charges (MTF) for students pursuing higher education.

scheme_name: Public Distribution System (PDS)
notes: The foundational system for distributing subsidized essential commodities like rice/ sugar/ and pulses to BPL families through ration cards.

scheme_name: Rythu Seva Kendras (RSKs) / Farmer Service Centers
notes: Village-level centers providing services like soil testing/ quality seeds/ fertilizers/ and technical advice to farmers.

scheme_name: Sampoorna Poshana
notes: A nutrition scheme for pregnant women/ lactating mothers/ and children (up to 6 years) to combat malnutrition through Anganwadi centers.

scheme_name: Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan Vidya Mitra
notes: Annual distribution of kits with school essentials (uniforms/ books/ bags/ shoes) to students in government schools.

scheme_name: Single Desk Portal
notes: A single-window clearance system for investors to get all required approvals and licenses for setting up industries.

scheme_name: State Industrial Policies
notes: A set of policies providing incentives like tax breaks/ capital subsidies/ and power subsidies to attract new industries and support MSMEs.

scheme_name: Swachh Andhra Mission
notes: State's initiative/ aligned with the Swachh Bharat Mission/ focusing on sanitation/ waste management/ and making the state Open Defecation Free (ODF).

scheme_name: Talli-Bidda Express (NTR Sisu Rakshak)
notes: Provides free transportation for mothers and newborns from government hospitals back to their homes after delivery.

scheme_name: Thalliki Vandanam
notes: Provides financial assistance of ₹15/000 annually to mothers for their children's education (Class 1 to Intermediate).

scheme_name: Unemployment Allowance (Nirudyoga Bruthi)
notes: Provides a monthly allowance of ₹3/000 to eligible unemployed youth.
